intro: Byrsella semiteres, commonly known as the narrow-leafed rock cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, linear leaves and small, bright yellow flowers arranged in racemes. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid environments. It is found primarily in regions of southern Africa, including Namibia and South Africa. Byrsella semiteres is adapted to withstand drought conditions and has a relatively short growing season.
